snippet: The Obama administration recalled Laurence Pope, who retired from the Foreign Service 12 years ago, to serve as the senior American envoy in Libya.
abstract: Obama administration recalls veteran diplomat Laurence Pope, who retired from Foreign Service in 2000, to serve as senior American envoy in Libya; appointment comes one month after death of Ambassador J Christopher Stevens in attack on American diplomatic compound in Benghazi.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration recalled Laurence Pope, who retired from the Foreign Service 12 years ago, to serve as the senior American envoy in Libya.

headline.seo: Laurence Pope Appointed to Envoy Post in Libya
headline.main: White House Appoints Veteran Retired Diplomat to Serve as Senior Envoy in Libya
headline.print_headline: White House Appoints Veteran Retired Diplomat to Serve as Senior Envoy in Libya
